choices.A: The maximum number of public IP addresses has already been reached.
choices.D: The two servers do not have enough virtual network adapters attached.
choices.C: There is no Internet gateway configured in the cloud environment.
choices.B: The two servers are not attached to the correct public subnet.

discussion.content: A, If they are all cloned from the same template they would all have the same configuration.
A- it happens that you do not request enough IP's from your provider

According to what I'm reading, cloning from a template gives you the option to individually add the IPs or use DHCP to handle the process. all this is done through the GUI to avoid having similar Computer names or IPs. 

https://www.nakivo.com/blog/vm-templates-a-to-z/

I say A. The maximum number of public IP addresses has already been reached.
the correct answer is D, because we need to attach virtual network adapters manually for private and public
D. The two servers do not have enough virtual network adapters attached.
I donot think D. Because of, six servers are deployed from a template, so there will be the same hardware configuration, can not have 2 servers lacking network card.

questions.question_text:
A cloud administrator has finished building a virtual server template in a public cloud environment. The administrator is now cloning six servers from that template.
Each server is configured with one private IP address and one public IP address. After starting the server instances, the cloud administrator notices that two of the servers do not have a public IP address. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause?

discussion.content: I would go with B, because the question is looking for which reason....
The answer is B. It's asking the reason, not what other way this can be achieved.
I think the answer is A. It makes the most sense.

choices.C: The administrator needs to write a new script function to call this service.
choices.A: The administrator can deploy the new load balancer via the cloud provider's web console.
choices.D: The administrator is not using the correct cloud provider account.
choices.B: The administrator needs to update the version of the CLI tool.

questions.question_text: A public cloud provider recently updated one of its services to provide a new type of application load balancer. The cloud administrator is tasked with building out a proof-of-concept using this new service type. The administrator sets out to update the scripts and notices the cloud provider does not list the load balancer as an available option type for deploying this service. Which of the following is the MOST likely reason?

comments.content: NO, read again. The CSA needs to confirm the deployment is utilizing the correct amount of CPU per virtual instance.

choices.D: the alarms on CPU utilization have been enabled.
choices.A: the VMs with the most CPU cores available have been selected.
choices.B: smaller VMs are being selected to reduce the total deployment cost.
choices.C: the deployment is utilizing the recommended amount of CPUs per VM.

questions.question_text: A courier company has virtualized its packing software application. The CSA needs to confirm the deployment is utilizing the correct amount of CPU per virtual instance. After confirming the deployment requirements, the CSA should log into the cloud services portal to ensure that:

A company security policy mandates education and training for new employees. The policy must outline acceptable use policies for SaaS applications. Given these requirements, which of the following security controls is BEST suited?

discussion.content:
We should be looking at A. Preventive Controls when talking about acceptable use policies. Acceptable use policies do not CORRECT an issue at all. They are set in stone to prevent them from occurring in the first place.

https://blogs.getcertifiedgetahead.com/security-controls-goals-1-of-3/
has to be A, we educate to prevent not to correct

Selected Answer: A
Obviously A, training employees is a way of preventing incidents from even happening

policies are a Preventive control. It's what happens before or how to prevent something from happening.

https://www.sciencedirect.com/topics/computer-science/preventative-control#:~:text=Preventative%20controls%20are%20designed%20to,%2C%20firewalls%2C%20and%20physical%20barriers.

Answer is A. Preventive

Can not A, because of "for SaaS applications". I think, the answer is C.
(https://www.f5.com/labs/articles/education/what-are-security-controls)

comments.content: I was wrong, it must A.

discussion.content: The answer is for sure C. "corrective" is when you mess up they have to correct your actions, but new employees couldnt have messed up yet lol so we will prevent them from ever messing up

comments.content: I MEAN A!!! THE ANSWER IS A!!!!!!

choices.C: Check the DHCP scope and increase the number of available IP addresses by extending the pool.
choices.B: Check current licensed capacity and purchase additional licenses to add more users.
choices.D: Check the rate-of-load increase to determine if the cloud capacity boundary has been exceeded and enable bursting to the pubic cloud.
choices.A: Check compute, storage, and networking utilization in the dashboard and increase capacity by adding more resources.

questions.question_text: A cloud administrator reports a problem with the maximum number of users reached in one of the pools. There are ten VMs in the pool, each with a software capacity to handle ten users. Based on the dashboard metrics, 15% of the incoming new service requests are failing. Which of the following is the BEST approach to resolve the issue?
